title: The Uncommon Appeal of Clouds
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Charlie now went to a small nursery  school round the corner, and Jamie would take him there at eight-thirty in the morning, deposit him in the classroom with his neatly packed tiffin box, and then return for him five hours later. After lunch, while Isabel worked in her study on the latest issue of the Review, Jamie would often supervise Charlie's afternoon rest, read to him, play the piano with him, or take him for a walk by the canal or, as a special treat, to Blackford Pond. That pond, inhabited by a tribe of over-fed and demanding  ducks, could keep Charlie amused for hours, and Jamie knew every inch of its muddy shore quite as well as an experienced  mariner knows the bays and inlets of his native waters.
